intro: Diabelia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf diabelia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Diabelia stenophylla is often found in maritime climates and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
